channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: How Biden is pressing a two-front war against Trump
item.description: Joe Biden has described himself as a "bridge" between the Democrats' current and future generations of leaders. But he may also be a bridge between its present and future on the electoral map.

item.title: Trump launches unprecedented attack on military leadership
'Foul mood today': Borger calls out Trump's attitude at news conference
item.description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin, Gloria Borger, Abby Phillip and Jim Acosta fact check President Trump's Labor Day news conference.

item.title: Australian journalists evacuated from China after five-day diplomatic standoff
item.description: Two Australian journalists working in China have left the country after they were questioned by police and forced to seek the protection of their country's government, their news organizations said Tuesday.

item.title: Woman who popularized the gender reveal party says enough already after latest wildfire
item.description: The woman best known for popularizing gender reveal parties has a message for the world: Please stop.

item.title: Hong Kong police under fire for tackling 12-year-old during protests
item.description: Police in Hong Kong police have come under heavy criticism after a widely-circulated video showed officers tackling a 12-year-old girl to the ground during a pro-democracy protest.

item.title: India alerts China after reports allege troops 'abducted' several civilians on disputed border
item.description: The Indian military has alerted China to allegations five men were "abducted" by the People's Liberation Army near the countries' hotly-disputed border in the Himalayas, an Indian official said Sunday.

item.title: Trump pushes misleading claim China is stoking protests to help Biden win election
item.description: President Donald Trump suggested on Monday that China is interfering in the 2020 election and attempting to hurt his reelection bid by encouraging race protests, tweeting an article written by a columnist whose claims do not match the US intelligence community's assessment of Beijing's efforts so far.

item.title: Russian opposition leader out of coma after poisoning, hospital says
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny is out of a medically induced coma, the German hospital where he is being treated said in a statement on Monday.

item.title: Trump tries and fails to get reporter to remove mask at news conference
Another federal official raises questions about Trump's vaccine timeline
item.description: Another federal official is making it clear that despite President Trump's predictions, there's hardly any chance a vaccine will be available to Americans by Election Day.

item.title: Britain is staring down the barrel of a no-deal Brexit again, and people on both sides are spooked
Father captures dramatic wildfire rescue during camping trip
item.description: The California Creek Fire suddenly engulfed the camp site where Jeremy Remington and his family were staying, leading to a helicopter rescue he caught on camera.

item.title: McEnroe on Djokovic: 'He's going to be the bad guy the rest of his career'
item.description: Novak Djokovic hitting a line judge with a ball has become one of the enduring images of an already bizarre season of tennis.

item.title: Saudi court sentences suspects in Jamal Khashoggi murder
item.description: Saudi Arabia has issued "final verdicts" against eight suspects in the murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi in October 2018 -- sentencing five of the defendants to 20 years in prison -- the state-run Saudi Press Agency (SPA) has reported, citing a public prosecutor spokesman.

item.title: Belarusian opposition says three leading members were abducted
item.description: Belarus' political opposition has said three of its leading members have been abducted, and called for their immediate release.

item.title: A Black man was detained while jogging for fitting a suspect description and later offered a job with the sheriff's department
item.description: A Black man jogging in the predominantly white neighborhood of Deltona, Florida, last month found himself handcuffed and detained when police said he matched the description of a suspect in a nearby burglary.

item.title: How to explore the vanishing sandbars of the Philippines
item.description: During the interview round of the 1994 Miss Universe Pageant, the presenter quizzed former Miss Philippines, Charlene Gonzales, about her home country's geography.

item.title: Live-stream shopping in China could be worth $170 billion this year. But it's a tough market to crack
item.description: Eight months ago, Meng Hu quit her job as a flight attendant in Guangzhou, China to pursue her dream of becoming an online star.

item.title: US sanction threat wipes 23% off the value of China's biggest chipmaker
item.description: Shares in Chinese chipmaker SMIC plummeted nearly 23% in Hong Kong on Monday on fears that it could become the latest casualty of the US-China tech war.

item.title: Kylian Mbappe tests positive for Covid-19 while playing with France
item.description: French football star Kylian Mbappe has tested positive for Covid-19 while on international duty, the French Football Federation (FFF) announced on Monday.

item.title: Hear Jacob Blake's message from his hospital bed
item.description: Speaking from his hospital bed as recovers from the injuries he sustained after being shot seven times by a Kenosha, Wisconsin, police officer, Jacob Blake delivered a message to his supporters, warning them that everything can change in an instant. Blake is now paralyzed from the waist down.

item.title: Nikki Haley's risky move on anti-Trump ad
item.description: Before Nikki Haley left the Trump administration as the US ambassador to the United Nations, she was not afraid to disagree with Donald Trump publicly. For example, after Trump infamously sided with Vladimir Putin in July 2018 over US intelligence agencies' conclusion that Russia's had interfered in the 2016 US elections, Haley stated, "We don't trust Russia. We don't trust Putin," adding, "They're never going to be our friend."

item.title: India didn't prioritize mental health before Covid-19. Now it's paying the price
item.description: "My heartbeats are heavy. It becomes difficult to catch my breath. My hands shake and get sweaty," said Aritri Paul of the terrifying panic attacks that strike more frequently since India went into coronavirus lockdown in March.

item.title: Tourist who took sand from Italian beach fined over $1,000
item.description: A French tourist has been ordered to pay a 1,000 ($1,200) fine after attempting to fly out of Sardinia with more than four pounds of local sand in his luggage.

item.title: Biden says he would get vaccine even if it cost him the election
item.description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden says he would get a Covid-19 vaccine if it became available and that President Donald Trump's misstatements about the coronavirus could undermine the public's confidence in a vaccine.

item.title: Gender reveal sparks massive wildfire in California
item.description: As multiple wildfires burn in California, one of the fires was started during a gender reveal party, officials said.

item.title: Ireland's lacrosse team gives its spot in international tournament to Native American team
item.description: In a remarkable show of sportsmanship, Ireland's lacrosse team is withdrawing from an international tournament to allow a Native American team to play instead.

item.title: An Air Force One that flies at five times the speed of sound?
item.description: There could be a supersonic Air Force One prototype airplane as early as 2025, with the US Air Force getting busy awarding development contracts.

item.title: Scale model of futuristic plane makes successful maiden flight
item.description: Researchers in the Netherlands say they have conducted a successful maiden flight of a scale model of the Flying-V, a plane that could one day carry passengers in its wings.

item.title: US service member injured in Al-Shabaab attack
item.description: A US service member was injured in Somalia Monday when Al-Shabaab attacked US and Somali forces, according to the US military.

item.title: 'I don't know what it takes at this point': Gupta vents about lack of mask wearing
item.description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta discusses a new model cited by top health experts, which projects that more than 400,000 people in the US could die from coronavirus by January 1st.

item.title: China launches and recovers reusable spacecraft: state media
item.description: China has launched and recovered a reusable spacecraft, an important step in the country's space program, state media reported Sunday.

item.title: This is why political campaigns feel free to lie in TV ads
item.description: The FCC requires commercial broadcast stations to provide reasonable access to presidential candidates. CNN's Brian Stelter breaks down why this allows political campaigns to peddle false or misleading claims in local ads.

item.title: The surreal and sensuous world of photographer Zhong Lin
item.description: Seductive pops of red and silvery blue appear in Zhong Lin's portraits of striking women. The self-taught Malaysian photographer, who aims to capture moments of transition in her bold and highly stylized photographs, has spent the past four months shooting a personal new series in Taiwan.

item.title: Explore a galaxy far, far away with the Sims 4 Star Wars: Journey to Batuu expansion
item.description: The Sims as a franchise is all about self-expression with Sims (the in-game characters you make) and the locations they're in. Aside from the "Create-a-Sim" functionality, you can pick a location, pick a plot of land and get to the building. It's easy enough to get the hang of, and you're building what you want or what you envision for the Sim.

item.title: How Emma Watson's Met Gala look changed the red carpet forever
item.description: The fashion industry is on a relentless pursuit to answer the question: What does luxury mean today? When I joined the actress and activist Emma Watson on a fitting for the custom-made Calvin Klein dress she wore to the Met gala in New York, she had a suggestion.

item.title: It's like nowhere else on Earth. Now it's in peril
item.description: Two veteran travel writers hope their crowdfunded book about the Yemeni island of Socotra will bring more attention to its unique landscape and wildlife and ensure it's safeguarded during a time of turmoil.

item.title: Ashleigh Barty will not defend her French Open title, announces she will not travel to Europe
item.description: World No. 1 Ashleigh Barty will not be in Paris to defend her French Open tennis title.

item.title: Melania's most talked about outfits
item.description: First Lady Melania Trump is known for her fashion sense. These are some of her most talked about outfits.

item.title: Confessions of an RV rookie -- and former naysayer
item.description: I had no idea when I decided to take the family on an RV vacation this summer that I would have to learn a whole new vocabulary.

item.title: World's slowest musical composition, set to play out over 639 years, just changed a chord
item.description: A musical composition designed to take well over 600 years to play has gone through its first chord change in seven years.

item.title: Vibrating suit allows deaf people to 'feel' music
item.description: Music is said to be a universal language. But for Chase Burton, a deaf filmmaker from Texas, music has always been a profoundly different experience.

item.title: Several boats sink during Trump parade
item.description: Boat parades in support of the President were held across the country, with one event on Lake Travis in Texas drawing "many" emergency responses according to local officials.

item.title: The President accused his own military officers of waging wars to boost the profits of defense manufacturing companies
item.description: President Donald Trump launched an unprecedented public attack against the leadership of the US military on Monday, accusing them of waging wars to boost the profits of defense manufacturing companies.

item.title: Watch tape of Trump's attacks on military
item.description: CNN anchor and military spouse Brianna Keilar reacts to The Atlantic's report claiming President Trump called soldiers "losers" and "suckers." President Trump has denied the allegations and CNN has not independently verified the report.

item.title: Analysis: How coronavirus will decide the 2020 race
item.description: With just 57days until the 2020 election, it will be time to vote before you know it. For our special Labor Day edition, I'm breaking down the five big storylines to watch between now and Election Day -- the narratives that will define the final stretch of the race between President Donald Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden.

item.title: Trump tries and fails to get reporter to remove mask
Why the Australia-EU trade model isn't a 'good outcome' for Britain
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is threatening to walk away from faltering trade talks with the European Union if a deal isn't reached next month, leaving Britain staring down the barrel of a damaging no-deal Brexit again.
